repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Third Kabupaten Roads
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Kabupaten Roads
            Development Project for Indonesia were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, project sustainability was likely, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            also satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            institutional factors tend to predominate over economic or
            technical factors in determining the success or otherwise of
            projects in the kabupaten roads sector. Proper attention
            needs to be paid to these, including a thorough stakeholder
            analysis. The objective of establishing an effective
            technical study framework that will feed into the existing
            institutional process of decision-making was ambitious, and
            could fully succeed only if there is a strong commitment at
            the top. Transferring the implementation leadership to MPW
            was not enough. Complexity is unavoidable in some projects,
            because of the need to work on several fronts in parallel.
            In such cases, one should not try to reduce artificially the
            number of objectives. But rather be realistic in setting
            sustainable targets for each objective. Projects dealing
            intensively with local governments are demanding in terms of
            supervision. If the thrust for more effective
            decentralization is to succeed, future projects should
            concentrate on a more limited number of provinces, and Bank
            supervision should be leveraged trilogy more interventions
            from the Field Office.

repnme.cdata!:
Indonesia - Third Kabupaten Roads
            Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objectives of the Third
            Kabupaten Roads Development Project are to improve access to
            the main economic centers in 73 kabupatens (districts) in
            nine provinces (West Java, West Kalimantan and all provinces
            of Sumatra except Riau) and to increase the capability of
            all agencies in the country dealing with kabupaten roads.
            The project includes the following main components: (a) a
            road network improvement component, subdivided into three
            subcomponents: (i) road works and supervision for the
            maintenance of an increasing share of the maintainable part
            of the kabupaten road network as well as rehabilitation and
            improvement of selected roads project kabupatens over three
            fiscal years starting in 1992/93; (ii) workshops and
            laboratories upgrading and equipping; (iii) provision of
            equipment, spare parts and supplies; (b) a training
            component, including development and  implementation of
            priority parts of a nationwide training program; and (c)
            technological assistance and studies for strengthening
            systems and procedures nationwide regarding planning,
            environmental analysis, and implementation of road works,
            and for helping the Government of Indonesia central agencies
            in monitoring project execution.
